website_summaries.verdict: Made of BPA-free plastic, this large-capacity fountain appeals to pets and those on a budget. The best deal around.
pros: Pets can drink from stream or bowl
Includes replaceable carbon filters and a "pre-filter."
cons: Cleaning is slightly more complicated because the fountain has several parts

customer_reviews.title: Slime Machine. 😥
customer_reviews.text: Loved the product when first purchased, our cat used it constantly. I clean it religiously once a week, using the dishwasher which is certainly more thorough than a hand wash. While the unit continues to operate flawlessly, I notice the water is very slimy when I clean it. It only takes the water a couple of days to get like this. No one in the online forums seems to know how to get rid of this. I called Drinkwell and they advised running vinegar through the fountain which I did for several hours. Tried again this week, the cat won't go near it, and the water is slimy again. I tap out.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Ohio

customer_reviews.title: rather seems like a poor design)
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this products "auto fill/stop" function does not work properly. I've had several occasions where I've come home to a garage floor full of water due to the "auto fill/stop"feature not working properly. Not only is this a nuisance but highly dangerous. (And yes, I keep the machine clean and level so its not a user error, rather seems like a poor design). Apparently I'm passed the return policy time window, lucky me!
customer_reviews.author: N. Saavedra

customer_reviews.title: Works well, requires monthly cleaning
customer_reviews.text: My 6-month-old kitten loved it instantly! It took our older cat a while to warm up to it, but they both gladly use it now. I like that it continually filters the water, as our tap water is poor quality. After two months of use, the water started running more slowly, and it was time to clean it. This process took about 20-30 minutes, there's a fair amount of disassembly to do in order to clean the motor. I highly recommend buying the cleaning kitas it worked well. I'm going to start cleaning it monthly now. The only reason it's getting a star off is because cleaning it can be a lengthy process. Otherwise I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Mohr

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to clean well
customer_reviews.text: Tl;dr - plastic is hard to clean, and it is not worth the frustration for its positive features The fountain is made entirely of plastic. And I don’t know if it’s cheap plastic or just poorly made, but there are seams and rough patches throughout the fountain. These seems and rough patches gather bacteria and mold, and they are nearly impossible to clean. I’ve tried cleaning it with washcloths, brushes, and scrub pads, and I can never get it fully clean. It is incredibly frustrating, and does not seem sanitary for my cats. Yes, it’s quiet and the waterfall effect is really nice. But it’s not worth the constant frustration of trying to clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Caitrin

customer_reviews.title: Dreadful functionality
customer_reviews.text: Whoever did the design never used it. The lid falls off at the slightest touch. there are no handles to lift it for cleaning. it gets really slimy and needs frequent through cleaning for your pet's safety. The wire routing is just a joke through a big hole in the bottom with no clips or routing to keep the wire in place when putting it back on the floor. You try to move it to reposition the wire and the lid falls off again.. Please get a pet owner/user involved on the design of the next iteration. The plus pint is the quality of the injection molding is very high.
customer_reviews.author: T. Wotton

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a whole month!
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about a month and then stopped. Followed all the cleaning instructions and it was used by only 1 small dog. Guessing it needs a new pump (if I can get one) but still disappointed after reading such great reviews and and it being an Amazon top seller. On a positive note the price is really good and the shipping was really fast! Unfortunately the product did not last.
customer_reviews.author: J. Herman

customer_reviews.title: Love the concept hate the slime
customer_reviews.text: This is a great water fountain for my two dogs. I really like the fact that the water is always moving but the timeframe for the filters is inaccurate! I have to clean it once a week because it gets very slimy. The filters have to be changed every cleaning which gets very costly. I do not use tap water either so that’s not the problem. Cleaning it is also time consuming... this is why I only gave it 3 stars. Also, it says you can use the double filter with it but I found the triple filter works best. I do not like the double filter in it!
customer_reviews.author: KMA

customer_reviews.title: Great fountain, even it's a little hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: Biggest con? Too many sharp corners that are hard to clean, and in hard to reach places which makes them even more difficult to clean. Buying their cleaning kit does help exponentially with that problem. Filters are OK - not really great. Other than that? Amazing fountain. Lasted me 2 years before the housing for the pump cracked. Very quite, even on its highest setting. Looks very sleek and modern and dogs loved it, even though they've never used a fountain before.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - SUPER LOUD- DOESNT FILTER- BLACK STUFF CAKE OUT OF PUMP AND CONTAMINATED WATER!
customer_reviews.text: 10 months into use black fuzzy tainted pieces came or of pump. This could've hurt and/ or killed my cat. Petsafe fixed the problem by provided a different model . THIS IS A SUPER NOISY WATER FOUNTIAN - WARNING! Sounds scared my cat off. Also wouldn't suck up the little food pieces and / or dirty water and purify . If you want a quiet , more compact fountain for your cat- get this one  . THE ZEN IS SUPER QUIET AND FILTERS SUPER WELL. EASIER disassemble for cleaning. A must buy . Even petsafe recommends the zen over this one. This one is actually meant more for dogs due too the fountain size .
customer_reviews.author: Jake Hudgeons

customer_reviews.title: Not Made to Last!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in March 2017 for my cat. It worked great until a few weeks ago - the pump doesn't hold up and makes the most annoying sound ever. I change the filter and deep clean the fountain with the PetSafe brand brushes once a month but the pump is a piece of garbage. I've started cleaning the pump once a week and it doesn't last. Now it makes a sound like the thing is empty but if I fill it it just overflows and keeps making the sound. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Mc

customer_reviews.title: Pain in the ass to clean. . . Weekly!
customer_reviews.text: Pain in the ass. This thing is only more hygienic than a normal water bowel if you stick to their intensive cleaning regiment to include taking the engine apart and cleaning that every two weeks. You also need to buy specialized cleaning utensils if you hope to get to every nook and cranny of the damn thing. I would rather clean and refill a normal bowel every day for the rest of my cat's life. Once it breaks, I am just going to toss it and go back to a normal water bowel.
customer_reviews.author: Lynette Luria

customer_reviews.title: Horrible design
customer_reviews.text: Does it work? Yes. Here are the design issues: Removable tank will not stand on it's own for simple filling. You have to awkwardly hold it steady to fill. After you've gotten cramp from balancing it under faucet you now have to put it back into place in the unit. These cheap b'tards couldn't bother with a pressure stopper, nope the water just flows out the bottom while turning it over. Eventually, you'll figure it out but it still sucks. Cheap gravity water bowl had a pressure stopper. Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Notyou

customer_reviews.title: Bought the fountain in 2008
customer_reviews.text: I've only had to change the motor once but all-in-all I'm pretty happy with the fountain. As far as the first motor goes, I'm not really sure it died. This second one stopped working yesterday so I started looking for a replacement when I ran into the video on how to clean it (I wasn't aware the unit could be opened up). Anyway, I opened it and saw that there was a buildup of some nasty gunk. I went ahead and cleaned it thoroughly, put it back together, secured it back in the fountain and voilà! it started up again. lol, I never cleaned the first one at all, so for all I know it still could've been good.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: My cats love drinking from the running water.
customer_reviews.text: Set up time is expected and took about an hour because of getting everything out of the box, following instructions CAREFULLY and washing parts as recommended. It’s not super “easy” assembly but it’s not “difficult” either. The instructions are good. After that, it works great. I’ve had mine for 2 months now and leave it plugged in and it’s still going strong. My cats go to it versus a water bowl so they do seem to like the running water a lot. I don’t any notice noise except when the water gets too low (evaporates). I add fresh water every other day. The water is recycling like a fountain. My cats love it! I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Pepper

customer_reviews.title: The motor of the fountain stopped working after 1 month and a half!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fountain in July, and it was delivered to me on the 27th of July. I plugged it in the next day, on the 28th. Today is September 18th, two days ago the fountain stopped working, suddenly. It's the third fountain from Pet safe Drinkwell that I buy with the same problem... the motor lasts one month and a half! I continue buying them, because my cats love them, and because they are not noisy. I clean the fountain every 3 or 4 days, so the dirtiness is not the reason why the motor stops working after a month and a half. I think you should improve the motors. Your fountains are nice, but its motors awful.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvie

customer_reviews.title: They really loved getting their water from the fountain and were drinking ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pet fountain for my two cats and small dog. They really loved getting their water from the fountain and were drinking much more water which is a good thing. However, it was very cumbersome and difficult to replace the water. The water leaked from the water holder when I replaced the water. Upon trying to take it apart, it was very flimsy and difficult for me to get back together. I have cleaned this product many times and each time it seemed harder to get back together. Today was the last straw. I would not recommend this pet fountain for anybody.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence D Van Etten

customer_reviews.title: Too big for cat use, unless you don't mind carrying over a gallon plus weight of fountain ...
customer_reviews.text: The product works fine, it's just for me, it's way too large and holds a ton of water which makes it heavy to carry. I wind up spilling water while carrying it. Idk I'll see how it holds up and update, but I really shoulve sent it back but needed something to use asap for summer heat for my rescue. I think this is better suited to dogs than cats, it's way too much water! I should've realized when it said it holds a gallon.
customer_reviews.author: Karen kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Pets love it as much as I do. Better than catit
customer_reviews.text: Got rid of the catit bowl because my pets sucked through it, and didn't quite like the filter. Especially since the replacement filters people were finding bugs and such... So ordered this. Love how easy it is to refill, and can actually see how much water is left. But cleaning it is a pain. Once a week I run the pump in a mug with hot water and dawn, then rince it throughly. Half of the bowl parts fit in the dish washer, just the middle part and tank doesn't. Which isn't a biggie. But the replacement filters are starting to get the same reviews about poor quality. Hope it changes soon
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Ok for a watering device
customer_reviews.text: The capacity and assembly is easy for this device. I'm waiting to see how my pets(cats and dogs) will respond. There is one flaw that is rather irritating. After filling up the portable reservoir, the cap with a retractable pin is useless. The cap leaks water and there is no rubber or anything to keep it from pouring water out once it is rotated. I was hoping the retractable pin would offer some resistance before fully inserting it into the base. For the cost of all the plastic, the tiny motor inside, and the leaking flaw, I wouldn't recommend this to another pet owner.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Easy cleaning, easy maintenance and quiet!
customer_reviews.text: Liked that it is easy to clean, assemble and is quiet. Compact too. Company is US based so can have CS and parts easily. Yet to find out if Peewee, who is sick with IBD, and who needs to DRINK from it, does so! Doesnt matter how much i like it! Amazon reduced price after i bought this half gallon one. I will update as to how much my very picky, albeit sick cat uses it. But so far 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Tommi

customer_reviews.title: Each of our pets use it readily
customer_reviews.text: Easily understood directions to assemble and to clean. Easy to refill with water. Sometimes our kitten just watches the water pour from the waterfall. We have two canines and one kitten, everybody uses the water feature, sometimes the waterfall sometimes the pool, whatever satisfies their fancy. God commands us to care for all creatures so my husband and I love to give ours the best we can afford. Donna~forgiven child of God
customer_reviews.author: DonnaDee

customer_reviews.title: The best you can buy
customer_reviews.text: This is excellent value for the price. My cats were suffering urinary issues (struvite crystals) and I wanted to add fountains to encourage them to drink more water, along with beginning to feed exclusively canned food. I purchased several different types of waterer and this is definitely everybody’s favorite. It holds a nice amount of water so that you’re not constantly refilling. It was a smooth flow, so even cats that are nervous about getting wet will still use it. Easy to assemble, easy to clean. If it gets low, I will often find my cats sitting beside it asking for it to be filled. Edit: it is a big hit with the ferrets and the dogs, also!
customer_reviews.author: UKCAT

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy but does the job
customer_reviews.text: The 1/2 gallon does the job but the plastic pieces that make up the body and the top are really flimsy. I expected thicker, sturdier plastic for 50 bucks. As well, there are an unusually large amount of pieces and parts, making putting this together the first time more like assembling some kind of kit. Honestly, for what basically amounts to an aquarium pump, filter, and thin plastic housing this should cost a lot less than it does. Disappointed. I found that if I remove the carbon filter the water stays cleaner a lot longer and doesn't bubble up. I fill this up from a Pur pitcher anyway, so it's already pre-filtered.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning it is a pain
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this drinking fountain. They were attracted to it immediately, and they seem to be drinking more often than before. But cleaning it every two weeks as recommended is a big hassle. The unit has lots of surface area with numerous tight corners, flanges, and crevices. Even worse is dissembling and reassembling the pump to clean it. The whole process takes a half hour, which is a significant drain on my free time. There are pumps on the market that operate in dirty ponds for years without failing from not being cleaned. Surely the manufacturer could do better.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Dimmitt

customer_reviews.title: Best fountain for cats who like to ruin fountains
customer_reviews.text: My cats only like running water but one of them loves to tip over water bowls and fountains. This fountain is large and heavy when completely full. My cat is unable to throw it onto the ground. He occasionally knocks the lid off the top in protest or paws at the pool to fill it with fur. I've tried 4 different types of running water fountains to appease this brat and this is the only one he has lived with for months. It's kind of difficult to clean and to refill it gets messy. The noise level is not bad considering the size of it. It doesn't scare my other very scared cat. He loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I dont like it.
customer_reviews.text: This fountain has always made a loud humming, and gurgling sounds. And there is no way to adjust how full the bowl gets. The flow yes not how deep the water gets. So it's right to the top. And now for the past few weeks its leaking or just overflowing. My carpet is Alway wet. And now the wood is looking weird. I WOULD NOT recommend or buy again. This is the second fountain I've had. The first one was different but never made these noises. And the overflow/ leaking is Not good at all.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn M.

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: My 16 y.o. cat really likes this fountain. She drinks from it several times a day, and also likes to play with it. She will stand next to it and bat at the stream of water for as long as 5 minutes. Pretty cute. I think having a water source she likes so much contributes to her health. Drawbacks are the mild hum of the motor, which you can hear when the room is quiet. Also it does collect hair and dirt, and we have to take it apart and clean it every week--but I expect you would have the same issues with any pet fountain.
customer_reviews.author: Arno Vosk

customer_reviews.title: Nice fountain, but not big enough
customer_reviews.text: I wish this product had a flat bottom for the reservoir. I was cleaning it, filled it, and didn't realize that I forgot to put the new filter in the actual dish (we have gross water) so I had to have my husband hold it. Also, we have 3 large dogs, the smallest being 60 pounds. I wouldn't recommend it for that many big dogs. The reservoir isn't big enough and the dish isn't deep enough...we have 2 fountains and have to refill the water at least twice per day (when it's not hot, when it's hot it's more like 6 times per day).
customer_reviews.author: Bulldogge mom

customer_reviews.title: Great way to get your dogs to drink more
customer_reviews.text: My dogs LOVE this fountain! Their previous fountain was the bubbling style and they much prefer this. I expected them to lick the stream but they all drink from the bottom. Even though this is a little bigger than their last one, I find myself filling it more often because they’re drinking more. Only complaints, you can see gross mouth floaters after a week which is usually when I clean it. Only takes about 5 minutes but I clean it way more than I cleaned the bubbler (where you couldn’t see mouth gunk). I have a sprayer on my sink which works great, but I imagine it would suck more to clean it without.
customer_reviews.author: Fischergirl

customer_reviews.title: Best so far
customer_reviews.text: It’s great but you can’t scratch the coating on the plastic or it goes down hill fast, bacteria gets into micro holes, do not even use blue scrubber, I messed up a couple now, I have been using magic eraser or just cloth ...... you must break the bacteria cycle though you can just put this out and refill forever. I can go two weeks before I notice any slim but not more. That being said my dog and cat love this, When I’m drying on cycle change, the cat refuses to drink from normal bowl, kitty likes her water fall.
customer_reviews.author: Norman J.

customer_reviews.title: Easier than 360  great fordd cats ... but not deep enough for dog
customer_reviews.text: Only had it a week. The filters are cheaper and easier to install than the stainless 360, they just slip into a slot accessed by a panel up top. The filter is anchored in a bracketed locale and the tube easily seated unlike 360. No legs to clip or cords to rerun like 360. It has a thicker stream and oned water flows option with a decent height for our 4 cats . Wush it had a deeper bowl, however as our aussie (35lbs) splashes water everywhere when drinking *eyeroll*
customer_reviews.author: TexasTripletMom

customer_reviews.title: Keeping it clean is key!
customer_reviews.text: This product is a little temperamental. If you don't clean it regularly, it will break. Other signs that it's time to clean it are any noise at all from this. Taking it apart to clean it is cumbersome too, and a bit messy. I would recommend getting the brush set to clean this if you don't already have bottle neck scrubbers. However as far as use, my cats love this. It stopped them from trying to drink out of the shower. A full reservoir of water and a full dish last about a week for 3 cats if you are going on vacation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt push water hard enough to ever create a fountain. Manual says to turn flow know counterclockwise to decrease flow even though indention says opposite. The connector tube has zero function. The foam filter stops the impeller but it doesnt matter because the impeller and pump are not strong enough to push water up pass the carbon filter.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Luera

customer_reviews.title: My cats really like this water foutain
customer_reviews.text: We had this water fountain in the past but the pump broke after a few years and we moved a couple of times so we didn't have it anymore. When my cat who has CKD started hanging out in the sink, we got it again and her health has improved and she no longer hangs out in the sink. Definitely a good water fountain for our cats. I think it's a little difficult to clean the clear plastic water compartment since I can't fit my hand in and scrub it down myself. That's the only thing I don't like about this water fountain.
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: So pleased we purchased for our pups!
customer_reviews.text: We have two picky Schnauzers who will only drink clean water. We were emptying multiple water bowls several times a day plus we only give our girls filtered bottled water! With this Drinkwell fountain, the water stays clean and cool since it’s filtered and my girls drink more water which is healthier for them. It is easy to take apart and clean. With two dogs using it, we do clean more often but it’s easy to do. And nice to only have one place for them to drink now. We love this fountain!!
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Cat Likes It
customer_reviews.text: After a couple months the fountain is working well and one out of three cats love to drink from it -- luckily the kitty that needed to drink more water is the one enjoying it, while the one who likes to drink from the sink does not . . . Cats are weird. It has an adjustable flow and is pretty easy to clean. Using filtered water - not tap - and haven't had any issues with fountain cleanliness. Some cotton swabs and a bottle brush help to clean out the pump and reservoir. Overall, great fountain and would recommend for cats.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Reads

customer_reviews.title: Nice but Leaky
customer_reviews.text: When we bought this initially it was really great. Our bunnies love it and it works well. It's very low profile so even my small bunny can reach easily. However, after a few months it began to leak and create huge messes. We clean it regularly, change the filter and still it leaks. We are a little confused why it does this now. After each deep cleaning it'll be okay, but eventually it'll leak after a short time again.
customer_reviews.author: Julio Salcedo

customer_reviews.title: Died in 7 months, hard to clean!
customer_reviews.text: So this is actually our third PetSafe fountain, we had two of the smaller size for our cats and recently upgraded to this version thinking it would be an improvement with the addition of a water reservoir feature. I could not be more disappointed. This thing gets DIRTY QUICK! I replace the filters twice as frequently as instructed and also clean it twice as frequently as instructed. Within two weeks I've got an algae bloom in the back. Definitely would recommend going with a different brand, I know I will be!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Z.

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but has issues with leaking.
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's a good fountain, but we have had a number of instances when refilling the water, there isn't a proper seal and so the water will overflow the fountain. Compared to the "classic" version, which we never had any problems with the reservoirs. we have had it overflow about every 3-4th time refilling. It could be a design flaw, having the reservoir so tightly coupled with the main body, where the classic model doesn't have that issue.
customer_reviews.author: G. Jack VT

customer_reviews.title: My puppy loves it
customer_reviews.text: My basset puppy loves running water and will drink from the water flow all the time while my other dog just likes the bowl. Cleaning is easy as all parts come apart. You can adjust the flow so it's not loud. If you have trouble getting the stream started I turn the black knob all the way to the left and dump a cup of water in the filtered tank. That seems to work. I've had a lot of practice on fish tanks. This is a very similar setup. Great water bowl for my dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Bookgamer

customer_reviews.title: this is a great waterer. The designers
customer_reviews.text: Other than the fact that the extra water container is round on the top so you cannot just sit it in a sink to fill, this is a great waterer. The designers, however, should have looked at function first. I have two of these waterers going at all times. to refill them I have to stand there and hold the stupid thing until it is full and then do it again for the 2nd one. If it was flat topped you could set them in the sink, do something else and come back to them to reinstall. STUPID. But, love the waterer itself and so do the cats.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: My cat adores this thing
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this. Cats are attracted to the sound of flowing water presumably because moving water is cleaner than stagnant water where bacteria can grow. You will need to clean it periodically at intervals determined by the water you use. This may involve descaling including disassembling the pump to clean and re-lubricate it. There are instructions that you need to preserve on how to do this but it is not difficult. My cat watches me do this to his beloved water bowl.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L. Rankin

customer_reviews.title: Great Cat Fountain
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my cat because she HAS to have running water or else she won't drink. The capacity is great, the filters are cheap and the extra water-holding tank is perfect for people who don't want to constantly refill the fountain. There is a bit of a loud annoying noise when the water is running a bit low, but refilling the tank takes care of that of course. The only downside is that if you don't have a dishwasher (me), the part of the fountain where you slip in the filter is pretty difficult to clean without special brushes. If you have those though, a bit of vinegar and dish soap does the trick!
customer_reviews.author: KatieDinz

customer_reviews.title: The only issues we've run into are the filters really gunk up the fountain and cause a moss like issue. This is happening indoors and not in ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. The only issues we've run into are the filters really gunk up the fountain and cause a moss like issue. This is happening indoors and not in sunlight. Once we stopped using the filters, the issue went away. The only other issue is cleaning it. You definitely need their cleaning kit (or make your own) because there are too many holes and crevices which gunk builds up. It would have been nice if it all came apart in a way to allow for easier cleaning. Dishwasher safe would have been a bonus but we knew going into this purchase it wasn't dishwasher safe. Aside from these issues, it's been working for over 2 years without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: May cause fire due to charger malfunction!!! Check daily
customer_reviews.text: I hate leaving bad reviews but this water fountain, short-circuited my room and bathroom, it literally blew a fuse when I left it on while I was at work, it melted the charger into the plug in due to high heat, and well I had other chargers in spare but it did the same to those after a few hours so I'm definitely returning this since it can greatly start a fire. Please make sure you check your chargers daily and if you see the burning near the coils, return your package asap because there's a severe problem with the charger, and this honestly needs to be checked!
customer_reviews.author: JulioxAl

customer_reviews.title: It was great at first
customer_reviews.text: I bought one a few years back. I didn't use it until I was in my own house. It was great at first, but now it's NOISY as all get out. Between the pump and the water flow. On top of that, no matter how often I clean it, there's a constant build up of some black stuff in the reservoir and the drinking area. I saw a picture on here from another user who said that they have to clean the motor. Which is not something I was ever told in the instructions. But I am now looking for a replacement because of how much trash this fountain actually is.
customer_reviews.author: LoveMMRomance

customer_reviews.title: I bought a spare last November when it was on a good sale. The old one started vomiting water all ...
customer_reviews.text: Never again with this thing. This is the second of these fountains I have owned as well as the stainless steel one. I bought my first one about a year ago when the motor died in the stainless steel one. I bought a spare last November when it was on a good sale. The old one started vomiting water all over the floor about a week ago so I hooked up the new one. Same thing. I'm done with Drinkwells.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D. Mccabe

customer_reviews.title: My Cavaliers LOVE it
customer_reviews.text: We bought a flat fountain on chewy twice. The second one only worked for a day. I upgraded to this one because of how much water it holds and the circulation to keep the water clean. My cavaliers LOVE it. I swear the first day they were drinking just for fun. They love the waterfall and drink from the top which prevents them from bending their necks. You can hear it in our small apartment but it’s a soothing noise so it hasn’t bothered us at all. It’s super easy to clean and maintain. Very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Maintenance
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. This water bowel requires daily maintenance. I think the circulation turns it into a humidifier and it must be refilled every day. The holding tank always manages to leak on connection. The bowl requires a complete disassembly and thorough cleaning at least once a week. The inlet vents on the pump get clogged up quickly among other pieces. Most annoying of all is a poorly designed top cap that doesn’t firmly click into place but keeps falling off. I finally had to wrap a rubber band around it. Mysteriously, sometimes it overflows, I have to keep it in a baking pan to catch water, per attached picture.
customer_reviews.author: PMD3669

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to Keep Clean
customer_reviews.text: I have had this water bowl for over a year now. This water bowl is very difficult to keep clean. Even after disassembling the unit and cleaning everything I can, I occasionally still get disgusting algae coming out of the pump into my dog's water. Even after trying to force water into the pump, I get a discharge of this algae muck. I don't recommend this product for anyone who loves their animal - I like my dog to have clean water.
customer_reviews.author: F Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: I like it because I don't have to empty and re-fill a water dish every day. I fill it up about once a week (one cat). After about 2 months it will grow a layer of some kind of slime and need to be cleaned. I know when it's dirty because my cat will lick water off the floor of the shower. It is not easy to clean as it has a lot of little nooks & crannys. Tip: Place it far away from your pet's food dish. If it's next to the food dish, your pet will get food in the water and it will need to be cleaned much more frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Byron J Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly built to last.
customer_reviews.text: Complete garbage. I bought this five months ago. For the first two months it worked quite well. My cats were madly in love with it. Eventually it had to be taken apart and deep cleaned (these fountains get slimy) and after that it's been hit or miss as to whether or not the fountain will run. I can hear the motor so that part didn't die but the water no longer flows. I'm now the proud owner of a $45 water dish. Mostly, I'm angry because my cats really did love it so much. The last three times I've taken it apart to clean it I've had no water flow at all.
customer_reviews.author: LadySeyton

customer_reviews.title: My cats love the fountain
customer_reviews.text: I have one cat who absolutely will not drink from from a bowl. Dexter loves this and is drinking regularly. I am able to keep fountain clean and relatively free of scum build up by rinsing out unit and filter and re filling with fresh water twice a week. I only need to do a thorough disassembly once every three months! BTW Dexter likes to fish out ice cubes from the bowl. I put a few cubes in the water bowl a couple of times a week.
customer_reviews.author: DominickL

customer_reviews.title: Dog prefers dirty water in outdoor fountains!  Bummer!
customer_reviews.text: I thought our dog was going to love this item since he likes to drink out of our outdoor fountains with the nasty water! Alas, that was not to be! He refuses to drink out of it and I believe that it is because there is a gurgling sound when he is drinking and water comes from the reservoir to refill the bowl. The first time he was drinking and this happened he jumped back and wouldn't go back to drinking. What a bummer since I was so excited! Even our brave "granddog" won't drink out of it! It works well but he won't drink out of it! It is a bit involved to clean it every week as well.
customer_reviews.author: DJC1965

customer_reviews.title: Really cute idea but poor design/execution. Could be great with some work and ...
customer_reviews.text: Really cute idea but poor design/execution. Could be great with some work and common sense. Worked great for about a month and despite two cleanings, the front reservoir would overflow (instead of cycling) and there would be water all over the floor. Good luck taking this thing from the floor to the sink and disassembling it without getting water all over the place. Also way too many nooks and crannies and parts to clean. And still it sits in my closet, in pieces until I dare try to hook it up again and see if it overflows again. I went back to using a regular water dish.
customer_reviews.author: Yinzer Grrl

customer_reviews.title: Healthful
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my sons cat. For a number of reasons. #1 while he was visiting I noticed his cats litter smelled way too strong. I have 2 cats and their litter never smells bad. #2 he is a young indoor only cat. #3 He likes to play in and knock over his water dishes. This has been a huge game changer. He still plays in the water, but he can't knock it over. He litter no longer has that strong odor. My son says its easy to clean. He washes it out once a week. It's very quiet
customer_reviews.author: TLL

customer_reviews.title: Great Watering Bowl. The pump is over a year old and working fine I have purchased two now
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of constantly changing the dog Watering Bowl and the cat Watering Bowl when a friend of mine suggested this... comes with a carbon filter which is great.. has an adjustable flow rate mechanism.. everything works as it should. It doesn't break, it is not noisy, it doesn't leak, and holds almost a gallon of water... but like any watering dish, you must take out any for materials that get inside the bowl such as random dog food or other items that the cats or dogs drop in there. This is not a reason not to purchase this product.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Kratochvil

customer_reviews.title: No better than a gallon/gravity dispenser
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money. Better than a simple bowl of water, but no different from a gravity/gallon dispenser. It doesn’t do a good job of filtering particles, accumulates the same scum in the bowl as my gravity dispenser, is fairly loud when it’s full, leaks water when you’re trying to replace the reservoir (which is incredibly irritating - my $10 gravity dispenser doesn’t) and my cats seem scared of it. The only thing it might have over the gallon/gravity type dispenser is that it seems to filter/catch cat hairs. Wish I’d returned it when I was still able to, it was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Kayland

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I hate this fountain. It is terribly designed. The water tank is rounded and is impossible to set down in a convenient position when refilling. The top cover that houses the replaceable filter comes off at the slightest touch. The water pump, even at the highest setting, pumps water so poorly (or else the bowl is designed so badly) that a substantial portion of the bowl remains stagnant, entirely defeating the purpose of a fountain. After a few frustrating weeks of trying to force this product to be functional despite its many flaws, I scrapped it and just went back to simple water bowls. I wouldn't even give this thing away.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: No longer works
customer_reviews.text: We had this for about 3 months and it suddenly stopped working. We figured it was too late to return. Wasted our money. That may not be the case for you, but that was our experience. If you buy one definitely save the box in case it stops working. It took about a week for our dogs to try it. One dog would never use it no matter what you did so we had to keep a bowl of water out for that dog. The cat seemed to not care one way or another about it.
customer_reviews.author: Islandphoenix

customer_reviews.title: Have had this for a few years, but it's noisy.
customer_reviews.text: I knocked two stars off the review because this unit is noisy if you set the water flow rate anything higher than minimum. I want to have higher flow rate so the water stay fresher longer, but the noise is unbearable. I will be shopping for a replacement that's quiet. Update: While the fountain still works after 3 years, black plastic particles start to come off the motor housing and i'm sure it's not good for my cat. Knock another 1 star off it.
customer_reviews.author: C. So

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre at best
customer_reviews.text: This water fountain a great idea but is an absolute pain to clean. When using this, I needed to clean it everyday because it gets slimy fast. In all fairness, I have a golden doodle with a thicker beard so it holds outside dirt and when she drinks, it basically cleans it. There are many nooks and crannies that need to be cleaned with a brush and even that is hard to do. After about a month, I packed it up and put it in the closet.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wilder

customer_reviews.title: It really should have been replaced after the first year or two just because the plastic is so dirty and stained
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this water fountain. However, after almost 3 years, the motor stopped working. It really should have been replaced after the first year or two just because the plastic is so dirty and stained. No amount of cleaning and scrubbing will remove the yellow build up from the fountain. Not to mention it is a nightmare to clean. Slime in all the corners and inside the motor itself. Had to retire this fountain and purchased a stainless steel fountain. Hopefully it will be easier to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Leaks substantially
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this, so much so that I bought a silicone mat when I noticed it was leaking to the point of seeping through my wood floors. I thought the silicone barrier would at least make it usable for our three pets, but the leak just pooled until it ran off the edges and saturated the floors again. For the price, I would expect better quality. Pro: my cat loved drinking from the stream. Con: water leaked all over, ruining my floors.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution for cats who don't drink enough water. Wash often!!!
customer_reviews.text: The only reason this isn't getting a full 5 stars is because the collection pool your pet drinks out of can get an odd gunk/film residue that makes the water I would assume bad for your pet. It's similar to what your shower curtain gets after a while. I don't want to say it's mold or mildew cause that sounds harsher than it really is, but it probably is that. Be sure to wipe out the tray at least every other week. Dismantling it and putting it through the dishwasher is an option too, not the motor of course. Otherwise this is amazing and my cat drinks so much more water now!!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L. Porter III

customer_reviews.title: Five stars! Works well with my shy cat!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve got a kitty who is pretty resistant to using most water fountains. I wanted to get her something that would help cycle and filter the water she drinks that wouldn’t have a loud motor that made her scared. Fortunately, this fountain does the trick as the only sound you hear is the movement of the water and not the pump. In addition, its design is very good with its large reservoir and and the water way is less apt to evaporate at room temperature. It’s pretty easy to clean and has been frustration free! This has my full recommendation!
customer_reviews.author: Lunar Kitten

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I want to add a picture but it doesn’t seem to be letting me. It’s super easy to assemble and take apart to clean. I recommend cleaning it at least once a week. My cats love it. I couldn’t get them to drink water from their bowls because they loved drinking from the sink too much. This fixes the problem. One of my cats likes drinking from the stream and the other from the dish. It’s perfect. Thank you! Just a little noisy when it needs more water.
customer_reviews.author: Kira Emmett Logan

customer_reviews.title: He's a schnauzer and his beard gets the water kind of nasty but what's really cool is the fountain is quite easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this brand of pet fountain for a while now. I have one for my cats and just got one for my dog. He's a schnauzer and his beard gets the water kind of nasty but what's really cool is the fountain is quite easy to clean. Just run some vinegar through it every week or two and you don't even hardly have to scrub it! Anyway I really like this particular fountain because it has a removable reservoir. Considering how much water he drinks, it keeps the fountain full and from running drive which I'm sure destroys the pump. Great product I would recommend this brand to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Snowflake

customer_reviews.title: QUIET AND EASY
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this and so does 1 of my cats. The other one is scared of his own shadow so running water freaks him out. But my other cat is obsessed and only drinks from the running water. Not noisy AT ALL. And I am a very light sleeper. Once you take it apart once it's like riding a bike. Real easy to clean. Just need to make sure you stay on top of cleaning it at least once a month, sometimes sooner if you have more than 1 animal using it or lots of dog slobber.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my kitties
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my senior cat who LOVES drinking from the sink. In order to not waste water turning the sink on for her every time she begged, I got this fountain, and she and my other cat both love it! The older cat has kidney failure so my vet told me this was an excellent idea to keep her fluids up. The trickling water is kind of loud at night though, especially when it starts running low. But it's really easy to refill and I've gotten used to the sound at this point. Definitely recommended to encourage your pets to drink!
customer_reviews.author: Stacymay D

customer_reviews.title: Cat Fountain
customer_reviews.text: Im so happy with this purchase. My cat always stares at the tub, but won't drink from any of the previous fountains I have bought. This stream let's her put her face in the stream without having to bend around any of the plastic parts. It also has a base big enough that she can drink from the bowl without getting her head wet if she wants. It holds an incredible amount of water and is virtually silent. The only time I can hear it is when my cat is actually drinking from it.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Came with broken pump... but customer service is great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my cat - whose original fountain broke, and needed it urgently. If my cat does not have running water, he freaks out and meows all day and night. When the fountain arrived, it was broken. I called customer service and we went through every possibility as to why the fountain did not work. The conclusion was - broken pump. Customer sent me a new pump right away. But the point is, I wish it never came broken in the first place.... even-though they were nice and I received a replacement, my cat meowed for an extra 5 days! It’s a good product, just don’t buy during emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: GeeGeeCheChe

customer_reviews.title: Too noisy and hard to refill
customer_reviews.text: I saw so many reviews about how this is quiet, so I can't imagine what the loud ones are like. The container to remove and refill with water is really cumbersome. It leaks water and so it's impossible to fill without making a mess. My cat was afraid of this and so we are returning it.
customer_reviews.author: LiteracySpecialist

customer_reviews.title: Lasts with care
customer_reviews.text: We disassemble and reassemble the fountain weekly to clean it and add fresh water. The provided instructions are very clear for how to properly maintain it. The process is quite easy and can be done quickly. Once a month we additionally change the filter. We've had zero problems with it and our cats love drinking from it. The 1/2 gallon size is great for our two cats. We add water to it about every other day.
customer_reviews.author: Writemom

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to like it
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this. I think it's a great idea. Unfortunately when it was plugged in, it made a horrible loud grinding noise. After that, neither doggos would go near it. Even when the water level was full, it still made sucking, slurping noises. Had to return.
customer_reviews.author: Sparkle_Titsworth

customer_reviews.title: Sink Faucet Loving Cat Is Is In Love!
customer_reviews.text: This water fountain bowl is fantastic! Our 15 year old cat is super picky when it comes to drinking water. We have tried to get him to use other kinds of fountain water bowls but he was always still crying to drink from the bathroom sink. He has been so content since we got this fountain and be has not asked to drink from the faucet at all. The way the water falls is so similar to the sink. We have not had it long so I can not attest to it's longevity yet, but it seems to be great quality and I expect it to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Best one out there!
customer_reviews.text: So this is my second time purchasing this fountain. I had the previous one for 3 years and it didn’t die I just think it was getting louder. I tried a couple others in the transition. Like the one with the flower top. My cats wouldn’t touch. They love this one. It doesn’t splash at all and it’s not noisy at all which makes me happy. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Fitnursecrit

customer_reviews.title: CATS LOVE IT 🐈🐈🐈🐈🐈🐈🐈🐈🐈
customer_reviews.text: Our cats love it. I only have one of them that drinks from the drip the others drink out of the bowl. but if your cat seem not to enjoy the water at first it may be because you need to wash it out with warm soapy water to take away the plastic taste. also some cats don't like the charcoal filter so if they don't drink from this fountain that could be the case so sometimes I take the filter out.Soon as I washed it out with warm soapy water they started lapping it up. just a suggestion. Also it's very quiet compared to the original.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: My 3 cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this has an upgrade to a smaller water fountain I had. My cats absolutely love this new fountain! I also like how it comes with a water container that you fill up. Has great water flow and pressure. Would recommend this product to other cat owners or small dog owners.. My cats make a bit of a mess with it by throwing their cat toys in it so I can imagine if a big dog used it, it would be messier.
customer_reviews.author: L. G.

customer_reviews.title: Bought March 2020 & loved it - As of August 2020 it is not working
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for the 5 months we've had it - my 2 small yorkies and XL cat all loved to drink from it and we liked that it kept the water circulating. However, 5 months in and the pump completely stopped working, even with regular cleaning. Looked at the replacement pumps but seems there are a lot of issues with the replacement pumps fitting/working so currently deciding if we should order a new one of these or one from the competitor.
customer_reviews.author: Jennie

customer_reviews.title: Stay away.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered December 2015. Is constantly getting gummed up with scum and dirt. Clean it once a week and order new filters. Wash in dishwasher. Scrub out parts. Still doesn't help. Today, tried to clean out the little pump, and the valve that controls the flow snapped right off in my hand. Cheap cheap cheap plastic. Company should be ashamed of themselves for charging this much for a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: P. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Good product, a bit noisy, will only last you 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I have owned multiple versions of this fountain. When they work they do pretty well. They are a bit noisy but the water stream is fun for cats. However, within 2 years they all break. Perhaps that’s just the nature of a continuously running pump. Still, I think the nature of the design makes it much easier to clean than many others (only a few pieces, and they can be cleaned in the dishwasher) so I overall I still think it’s a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Joce323

customer_reviews.title: Hoping new one is a lemon
customer_reviews.text: After (with strays) we ended up with 5 cats, we went to dry food, (Just too many cans!) Was so glad that this seemed to encourage the boys, in particular, to drink more. Worked well for years. Then, started leaking. Keeping the filter clean seemed to help. Also, turning down the flow. Was very careful not to spill when adding water. However, still continued to occasionally leak. (seam open?) Finally ordered a new one. This one leaked from the start. We liked it so well, I am trying a replacement. If it would last without leading as long as the original, it would be worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: ppp

customer_reviews.title: Gross and slimy within a week
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this drinking fountain at the end of July and ordered additional filters. Within one week, the drinking area is absolutely filthy with “slimy” residue on the sides and at the gate where the water flows from the front to the back. Given that all the water doesn’t actually flow though the filter, most of the water isn’t actually filtered. And the drinking area is just gross! I’ve stopped using it all together.
customer_reviews.author: J. HANSEN

customer_reviews.title: Tends to overflow
customer_reviews.text: We’ve now tried two of these. They start working fine and slowly the water level creeps up until the fountain overflows. At first, cleaning it will prevent this. But each time the interval between cleanings gets shorter and shorter, until it’s overflowing on a regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen R. Balzac

customer_reviews.title: Would be great automatic waterer IF the pump worked!
customer_reviews.text: Product design itself it very nice but it's not worth almost $50 if it doesn't actually move any water. Unlike other customer reviews who have reported pump failures after a few months, the one I received came with a dead water pump. Seems the China factory that makes the pumps needs better quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer Advocate

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design, poor longevity
customer_reviews.text: It’s a fantastic watering system for pets. Quiet and I loved the modular design And relative ease in cleaning. But it lacks in the longevity department. Less than 9 months in, the motor has gradually slowed to a crawl and the water barely comes out. This started about 6 weeks ago and is now unusable. I refill weekly and deep clean every 3-4 weeks. Maybe my experience is a one-off, but I’m bummed that I’ll be forking out more money for a new unit so soon.
customer_reviews.author: PAmama

customer_reviews.title: Not what it seems
customer_reviews.text: We've had this fountain since Aug 2019. I've replaced the motor, cleaned out on a regular basis and we use bottled water. For a couple months now it occasionally leaks from the bottom. I haven't been able to figure out how or where from. I thought maybe I wasn't putting the water container on correctly, but it wasn't that either. It's a good thing I had it sitting in a boot tray (just in case). With all the water leaking out it would have ruined wood floors.
customer_reviews.author: DN

customer_reviews.title: Best Pet Fountain Ever
customer_reviews.text: I had this exact fountain for years, and the old one was still working fine, but had built up a lime coating inside on the bowl, so I decided to get a new one. (We use spring water. ) The new one is the very same design, which proves to me it couldn't be improved on. The new one works great too, same motor, same design. I change the water about every 6 weeks and take apart the motor and clean it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Too noisy
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this product three or four times now. The lastest one was too noisy. I think I found the reason for it. The pump is not well affixed on the surface. The surface on which the pump is supposed to be affixed is not flat (There are some lines protruding from the surface). As a result, the suction disks do not do a good job of affixing the pump. This creates a lot of noise constantly (and sometimes unbearable noise).
customer_reviews.author: retinex2

customer_reviews.title: Pet Water fountain
customer_reviews.text: All our pets use it and we have 3, 2 dog shih tzus and 1 cat russian blue. They all seem to like using it and it has no issue for them but I noticed water still gets dirty even with filter, every time I clean it I have to take it apart and the top falls off easy. The other issue is if you run low on water it is loud which I guess is good because you know it's low and can fill it but it is loud.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Silva

customer_reviews.title: Pets like it but they leak.
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through two of these items- the first leaked and lead to a puddle around the device so it was returned for a replacement item. The second was received and leaked as well. It could be my pets making a mess with the water but I have not had this issue with any other water bowls or devices. What leads me to believe they are prone to leaking is that there is an excessive amount of water around the bowl even when animals have not drank from it in a while.
customer_reviews.author: EchoPacific

customer_reviews.title: not a long-lived machine
customer_reviews.text: Both my cats and dogs used this and seemed to like it. I cleaned it every 2-3 weeks, but it only lasted 15 months before the motor went belly-up. I've got half a box of filters unopened, but I won't be buying a replacement of this model. Too expensive for the short life span.
customer_reviews.author: KSA

customer_reviews.title: gets slimey every 3 days and very heavy and spills all over when picking it up off the floor
customer_reviews.text: one cat and Lhasa apso loves it and 2 other cats and golden not so much....it leakes all over ...thankfully I keep in in a tray but between the slime. and weight to move it while spilling all over and only 2 out of 5 pets using it and my return is past due its going in the garbage
customer_reviews.author: lhasa lover

customer_reviews.title: Here's what you need to know
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered a 'like new' and received lots of unknown pet hair and a moldy wet filter in a bag. BUT, AMAZON resolved that ASAP and now a solid review: I do wish this had a covered watered reservoir, but I like this design. I have corgis that have grown to loathe each other so I bought them each one for their own areas. One got this and one got the original style. Both are great but the other dog drinks more so the larger capacity works better for her. Filtration is good, everything is simple and easy JUST DON'T BE LAZY AND NOT CLEAN IT. The water stays surprisingly cooler now that it's in constant circulation.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Lamothe

customer_reviews.title: Dog drinks more water now
customer_reviews.text: We were having issues with our dog not drinking enough water resulting in very bad breath and mild dehydration. She loves the recirculating fountain. The tank does smell moldy if you don't wash it with each refill, as expected with standing water. Also use caution to make sure you clean the bottom filter in the bowl, if it is blocked a bit it will not draw in the water fast enough and it can overflow. We caught it when the water level appeared higher than usual, but was not on our regular to do list.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hutchinson

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it!!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this fountain! Our 11 year old loves drinking from the kitchen faucet so I got this fountain to see if he would like it. He loves it. He was drinking from it before we finished putting it together. Our other cat started drinking from it pretty soon too. They both drink from the stream. We have it in the living room and it’s nice to hear the water flowing but we do have to turn the tv a little louder. I will probably put the fountain on a timer so it turns off for a few hours in the evening. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: dsmseanez

customer_reviews.title: Falling Water Makes More Noise Than Expected
customer_reviews.text: If the sound of falling water into a small pool is something you can ignore or enjoy, this fountain is for you. We would turn the water to the lowest setting or risk hearing the water fountain while trying to sleep at night. It's a constant back ground noise. Cleaning was cumbersome. When the power cord failed after three years, we switched to a quiet fountain that bubbles water versus falling water.
customer_reviews.author: Ami

customer_reviews.title: The "Adorable A-Hole" loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My little rat loves this thing. He was mesmerized by it at first but now he's always drinking from the stream (never the bowl). It started making odd noises today so I realized it needed more water. I've only had it 2 days. I doubt the cat drank that much water. But I replenished anyway and that solved the problem. I only use pre-filtered water so I'm really not even sure where the included filters go. A star off because the need to take this apart and clean it weekly is a royal pain in the butt. I'm spoiled - I prefer low maintenance plug-n-play. This is not. We'll see.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Cilantro

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our cat. She loves running water. This thing is perfect. I chose this one because it got good reviews and was. Offer than most of the other ones. I also have a dog that drinks out of the bowl part. He doesn’t care about the running water. But it’s big enough that it doesn’t run out of water after one day. I had a diff one and the motor burned out cuz it was too small and ran out of water.
customer_reviews.author: Chad H.

product_meta.title: PetSafe Drinkwell Cat and Dog Water Fountain - Platinum, 1/2 or 1 Gallon Pet Drinking Fountain - 64 oz, 128 oz or 168 oz
product_meta.description:
Style:Platinum - 168 oz

The PetSafe Drinkwell Platinum Pet Fountain gives your dog or cat 168 oz. of fresh, filtered water. The activated carbon filter removes bad tastes and odors, while the free falling stream of water entices your pet to drink more. The built in reservoir increases capacity and makes refills easy. The snap on reservoir lid and rubber feet on the bottom of the fountain prevent sliding and tipping.



Included in the Box

 * PetSafe Drinkwell Platinum Pet Fountain
 * Carbon Filter
 * Fountain Pump with Adaptor
 * Instruction Manual



Product Dimensions

 * Water Capacity: 168 oz.
 * Fountain Assembled: 15.75 in. L x 10.5 in. W x 10 in. H
 * Power Cord Length: Approximately 5.5 ft.



Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Can I use this drinking fountain outside?

A: No, this pet water fountain is designed for indoor use only.



Q: How often should I clean my pump?

A: You should disassemble and clean your pump every 2 4 weeks to help keep your fountain running optimally.
feature_bullets: Large water capacity: 168 ounce water capacity is great for pets of all sizes or multiple pets
Encourages drinking: Free-falling stream entices pets to drink more water
Filtered water: Includes replaceable carbon water filter that removes bad tastes and odors, keeping water fresh
Less refills: Built-in reservoir increases capacity and extends time between refilling your fountain
Adjustable stream: The pumps adjustable flow allows you to customize the water flow for your pet
Easy-to-clean: Fountain is BPA-free and top-shelf dishwasher safe
U.S. based customer care: Let our pet product experts help
